techmeme.title: AWS plans to spend £8B in the UK to grow its cloud business, expecting to support up to 14,000 jobs and contribute £14B to the UK GDP between 2024 and 2028 (Joe Mayes/Bloomberg)
Maryland-based Forterra, which develops autonomous driving tech for military and commercial vehicles, raised a $75M Series B (Maria Deutscher/SiliconANGLE)
MariaDB, which went public via SPAC in late 2022, says it's been acquired by PE firm K1 and names a new CEO, after filing to delist its shares from the NYSE (Paul Sawers/TechCrunch)
NYC-based Versana, a two-year-old platform that allows lenders to access data about $2.7T worth of loans, raised $26M from Barclays, Bank of America, and others (Jan-Henrik Foerster/Bloomberg)
Google plans to buy carbon removal credits from direct air capture provider Holocene for $100 per ton, far below current prices, for delivery by the early 2030s (Justine Calma/The Verge)
